title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. stocks rose after Wednesday's selloff, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq gaining 1.4%, 1.8% and 0.8%, respectively.

Grab's shares lost more than one-fifth of their value on their first day of trading in New York, a blow to the company after its record-breaking merger with a SPAC.

BuzzFeed will raise roughly $16 million from its public listing, after the blank-check company it is merging with suffered a wave of investor withdrawals.

EU authorities fined four banks close to $400 million for manipulating the foreign-currency market by exchanging sensitive information and trading plans.

China's air-safety regulators issued a key safety approval for Boeing's 737 MAX, bringing the aircraft a step closer to resuming passenger service in that country.

Chinese developer Kaisa failed to persuade bondholders to agree to a $400 million debt swap and said it might not be able to repay creditors when the bonds it was trying to exchange mature.

What's News: Business & Finance
